snippet: The intercepted telephone conversations, if proved accurate, describe an elaborate effort to reward Argentina for shipping food to Iran and for seeking to derail the investigation into a terrorist attack.
abstract: Secret negotiations for Argentina to receive oil from Iran in exchange for thwarting investigation into 1994 bombing of Jewish community center are confirmed in transcripts of telephone conversations between governments; deal did not go through, as Argentine officials could not get Interpol to lift arrest warrants on Iranian officials; transcripts are made public as part of part of criminal complaint filed by Alberto Nisman, special prosecutor investigating bombing, who was found dead night before he would have presented findings to Congress.

byline.original: By JONATHAN GILBERT and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: Jonathan Gilbert reported from Buenos Aires, and Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro. Rick Gladstone contributing reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The intercepted telephone conversations, if proved accurate, describe an elaborate effort to reward Argentina for shipping food to Iran and for seeking to derail the investigation into a terrorist attack.

headline.main: Argentine Phone Calls Detail Efforts to Shield Iran
headline.print_headline: In Argentina, Hints of Effort to Shield Iran

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
